content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find the Return Policy for Mens Rhinestone Skull Graphic Shirt on Amazon. Color: Black, Size: XX-Large. If Free return is avaliable, tell me how to return this item.  Please interact with https://www.amazon.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to stay on Amazon.com (the US site) because the task is specific to Amazon.com and not Amazon.ca. Dismissing this popup is necessary to proceed with the search for the Men's Rhinestone Skull Graphic Shirt and its return policy.
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.05
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to search for the "Mens Rhinestone Skull Graphic Shirt" on Amazon to find its product page and check the return policy. The search bar is available at [2].
Action: Type [2]; Mens Rhinestone Skull Graphic Shirt Black XX-Large
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.15
token: : Type [2]; Mens Rhinestone Skull Graphic Shirt Black XX-Large

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The first search result [17] matches the task request: "HZCX FASHION Mens Rhinestone Skull Graphic Shirt Round Collar Short Sleeve Tees." I need to access this product page to check details about the return policy and if "Free return" is available, as well as how to return the item.
Action: Click [17]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am on the product page for the HZCX FASHION Mens Rhinestone Skull Graphic Shirt. To check the return policy and see if free returns are available, I need to scroll down or look around the area near the price and shipping information, which is not immediately visible in this screenshot.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I see more details about the shirt, but no information about returns or free returns yet. The return policy is typically found further down the page or in a dedicated section. I need to keep scrolling to locate the return details.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This section is showing related products and deals, not the return policy. I still haven't found the return policy or information on free returns for the specific Men's Rhinestone Skull Graphic Shirt. I need to continue scrolling down to find the return details, which are often further down the product page.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.37
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am currently at the product videos section and still have not found the return policy information. The return details are usually in a dedicated section further down or within the product information area. I need to keep scrolling to find explicit return policy information, including "Free returns" if available.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am in the "Product details" section, but I still do not see any return policy or information about free returns. These are typically found in the “Product description” or in a dedicated section (often below the details), so further scrolling is needed.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am currently in the "Product description" section with images and a title, but there is still no mention of the return policy or whether free returns are available. The return policy is often found below the product description or in a clearly marked section. I should continue scrolling.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This section provides information about the material and features of the shirt, but there is still no mention of the return policy or free returns. I need to continue scrolling down to find that information.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This section describes the wash test and details about the shirt's material quality. There is still no information on the return policy or free returns. I need to keep scrolling down to find the returns section, which may be at the bottom of the product page or below these details.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have reached the "Similar Style" section, which means the product details are ending. The return policy is usually above this area, but it may also be included near the top with shipping or price details. Since I haven’t seen the return information yet, I should scroll up toward the top of the product page, especially to the area by the price/add to cart, to check for "Free returns" or the return policy note.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.65

Thought: I am currently scrolled up but still in the product details and wash test section, and not yet at the area near the price or purchase options, where return policy information is typically displayed. I need to scroll up further to reach the top of the product page, where return policy or "Free returns" indicators are usually present.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.68

Thought: I am getting closer to the top of the product page, but I am still in the product description and information section. The return policy and "Free returns" indicator are typically located near the price/add to cart area, which should be further up. I need to scroll up again to reach the top portion of the product page.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.7

Thought: I am still in the product description section with images of the shirts, but have not yet reached the area near the price/add to cart where the return policy or "free returns" information is typically displayed. I need to scroll up further to reach the top of the product page.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.72
